clinical_study.official_title: Nursing Students Education Training in Emotional Connection

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether an educational module is successful in training primary care nurse practitioner (PNP) students to assess the emotional connection of mother/child dyads with accuracy, and to determine how the education is maintained three months after administering.
The investigators hypothesize than after completing the educational module involving recorded dyad interactions, subjects will achieve coding reliability with the PI, which will be maintained after three months without practice coding.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and test an educational intervention designed to instruct primary care nurse practitioner (PNP) trainees how to assess the quality and strength of mother-child relationships. The approach will use constructs of Emotional Connectivity that were used in development of an investigational observation-based screening instrument, the Welch Emotional Connection Scale (WECS). The WECS is a scale that allows healthcare providers to rate the emotional connectivity of a mother-child relationship in just a few minutes of observed interaction, and shows preliminary predictive properties when performed in the first year of life. Administration of the WECS involves watching recorded interactions of a child sitting face-to-face on the mother's lap, and scores the interaction on sliding scales in 4 domains. During the WECS development, the Nurture Science Program of Columbia University Medical Center created and coded hours of parent-child interaction videos. These videos will be used to assess and train the PNP students (subjects) on rating mother/child dyads around emotional connectivity. Subjects will rate the quality of mother-child relationships in prepared educational video cases. After all subjects rate in a way that achieves high reliability with PI scores of the same recorded dyads, subjects will spend 3 months without further training in emotional connection or practice coding WECS. Subjects will then rate the quality of mother-child relationships for videos of dyads they hadn't previously seen. Maintenance of high reliability of coding dyad interaction is the main outcome of this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Intra-Class Correlations of Students' Welch Emotional Connection Screen (WECS) Scores
primary_outcome.description: The Welch Emotional Connection Scale (WECS) is an investigational developmental screening tool, developed to rate the quality of the emotional connection that formed between mother and child. The scale is administered in 2-3 minutes by observing a mother and child interact, and requires the rater to critically assess 4 sub-domains of emotional connection. The WECS is scored on intervals of 0.25, with a minimum of 1 (little or no connection) and maximum of 3 (high connection). High connection is considered optimal for child development, and low connection is considered a risk in child development. Separately from these scores, the final portion of the screen determines, "Is the dyad emotionally connected?" and is scored with "No" or "Yes." Observing these scores could help determine if the educational module is successful in training PNP students to assess the emotional connection.

intervention.description: Didactic education (video-supported educational module) on emotional connectivity will be offered to the subjects. Subjects will conference with PI to review ratings on modules.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric PNP students from Columbia University School of Nursing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- volunteering students who are in their final year of the PNP program and are earning clinical hours at the Nurture Science Program.
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to participate
